LanguageData.WornBulk.label: worn bulk
LanguageData.WornBulk.description: How bulky this apparel is to wear.
LanguageData.ArmorRating_Electric.label: Armor - Electric
LanguageData.ArmorRating_Electric.description: The chance to affect electricity-related damage like EMP pulses and burns.\n\nUpon taking damage, first this armor rating is reduced by the attack's armor penetration value. The remaining armor forms a percentage reduction of damage.
LanguageData.ElectricDamageMultiplier.label: electric damage
LanguageData.ElectricDamageMultiplier.description: A multiplier on damage from electric-type attacks for weapons made of this material.
LanguageData.Bulk.label: bulk
LanguageData.Bulk.description: The amount of inventory space an item takes up when carried in bag or pocket.
LanguageData.AmmoCaliber.label: caliber
LanguageData.AmmoCaliber.description: The guns which accept this type of ammo.
LanguageData.AimingAccuracy.label: aiming accuracy
LanguageData.AimingAccuracy.description:
How well a shooter can lead moving targets and estimate range in combination with the weapon's aiming efficiency.

The final modifier is calculated via this formula:
(1.5 - aiming accuracy) / aiming efficiency

Lead error is calculated by multiplying this factor against total lead distance in cells. Range error is calculated by multiplying it against the total distance to the target divided by 4.

Aiming accuracy influences the the sway reduction during aimed shots. For example, at 75% aiming accuracy sway will be reduced to 25%.
LanguageData.ReloadSpeed.label: reload speed
LanguageData.ReloadSpeed.description: The speed at which firearms are reloaded.
LanguageData.Suppressability.label: suppressability
LanguageData.Suppressability.description: How susceptible this person is to suppression. Loss of consciousness and certain drugs can lower this value, making it harder to suppress this person.
LanguageData.AverageSharpArmor.label: armor coverage
LanguageData.AverageSharpArmor.description: The average value of armor coverage across this person's body. Higher values will make them more confident against low-penetration projectiles.
LanguageData.MeleeArmorPenetration.label: melee armor penetration
LanguageData.MeleeArmorPenetration.description: Armor penetration in melee. Determines how much damage is lost to enemy armor.
LanguageData.MeleeCritChance.label: melee critical chance
LanguageData.MeleeCritChance.description: Base chance to critically hit a target in melee.\n\nThe final chance depends on the opponent's critical skill and equal opponents will always have a 10% chance to crit.
LanguageData.MeleeDodgeChance.label: melee dodge chance
LanguageData.MeleeDodgeChance.description: Chance to dodge a melee attack that would've otherwise hit. Characters will not dodge while aiming or firing a ranged weapon.
LanguageData.MeleeParryChance.label: melee parry chance
LanguageData.MeleeParryChance.description: Base chance to parry a melee attack. When a parry is performed the equipped weapon or shield will take damage instead of the wielder. If the parrying pawn passes a critical chance check they will automatically riposte their attacker.\n\nThe final chance depends on the opponent's parry skill and equal opponents will always have a 20% chance to parry.
LanguageData.UnarmedDamage.label: unarmed damage bonus
LanguageData.UnarmedDamage.description: Additional damage done in unarmed combat.
LanguageData.BodyPartSharpArmor.description: Compared against weapon's armor penetration to see if it can penetrate to the next layer of body parts. A high value means low-penetration attacks like buckshot will have a harder time hitting internal organs.
LanguageData.BodyPartSharpArmor.label: body part RHA
LanguageData.BodyPartBluntArmor.description: Compared against weapon's armor penetration to see if it can penetrate to the next layer of body parts. A high value means low-penetration attacks like buckshot will have a harder time hitting internal organs.
LanguageData.BodyPartBluntArmor.label: body part MPa
LanguageData.SmokeSensitivity.label: smoke sensitivity
LanguageData.SmokeSensitivity.description: Multiplier on the impact of smoke inhalation on this creature.
LanguageData.CarryWeight.label: carry weight
LanguageData.CarryWeight.description: The amount of weight this creature can carry in pockets, bags or otherwise attached to its body.
LanguageData.CarryBulk.label: bulk capacity
LanguageData.CarryBulk.description: The volume of items this creature can carry in pockets, bags or otherwise attached to its body.
LanguageData.StuffPower_Armor_Electric.label: Armor - Electric
LanguageData.StuffPower_Armor_Electric.description: Armor against electric damage like EMPs.
LanguageData.MeleeDamage.label: melee damage
LanguageData.MeleeDamage.description: Damage ranges for each of this weapon's tools.
LanguageData.MeleePenetrationFactor.label: melee armor penetration factor
LanguageData.MeleePenetrationFactor.description: Capability to penetrate armor on a melee strike. This multiplier is applied to all melee attacks made with this weapon.\n\nThe base value is determined by the tool used.
LanguageData.MeleeCounterParryBonus.label: melee counter parry bonus
LanguageData.MeleeCounterParryBonus.description: When attacking an opponent with this weapon, the opponent's parry chance is divided by this value.\n\nThis is applied prior to determining the final parry chance.
LanguageData.SightsEfficiency.label: sights efficiency
LanguageData.SightsEfficiency.description:
How good the sights on this weapon are. Quality sights reduce range errors and improve target leading. This is multiplied against the aiming accuracy of the shooter to calculate the amount of range and lead error.

The final modifier is calculated via this formula:
(1.5 - aiming accuracy) / aiming efficiency

Lead error is calculated by multiplying this factor against total lead distance in cells. Range error is calculated by multiplying it against the total distance to the target divided by 4.
LanguageData.ShotSpread.label: spread
LanguageData.ShotSpread.description: Inherent projectile spread. This represents the inherent inaccuracy of the gun and causes random conical deviation that is not influenced by skill.
LanguageData.SwayFactor.label: weapon sway
LanguageData.SwayFactor.description:
How difficult the gun is to keep steady. 

The total sway is calculated as:
(4.5 - shooting accuracy) * weapon sway factor

Aiming accuracy influences the sway reduction during aimed shots. For example, at 75% aiming accuracy sway will be reduced to 25%.
LanguageData.Caliber.label: caliber
LanguageData.Caliber.description: The types of ammo this gun accepts.
LanguageData.MagazineCapacity.label: magazine capacity
LanguageData.MagazineCapacity.description: How many projectiles this weapon's magazine holds and how long it takes to reload it.
LanguageData.ammoConsumedPerShotCount.label: ammo consumed per shot
LanguageData.ammoConsumedPerShotCount.description: How many units of ammunition this gun consumes for each individual shot.\n\nThis applies to guns with multiple barrels that fire simultaneously with each pull of the trigger, or exotic energy weapons that use up different amounts of energy from a power cell.
